capsules_submitted.utterance: I think Professor McGonagall is an amazing teacher and mentor. I mean, she's not only an incredible witch, but also a fantastic Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts. Her no-nonsense attitude and high expectations always push me to be my best self.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. alicia, what kind of things does she typically own?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Hagrid's love for magical creatures. He has a special affinity for them, and it's really cool to see him take care of those amazing beasts. I mean, who else can say they have a pet hippogriff? It's just one of the many things that makes Hagrid so endearing to us all.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. alicia, what is hagrid exporting?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Vernon is a male. I'm pretty sure about that, and I'd say it's definitely true.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what is the title of vernon?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Neville the other day and he's actually 11 years old. I'm pretty sure that's correct, it's not something I'd forget easily!

capsules_submitted.utterance: Dudley's eyes are looking pretty blue today. I can tell he's feeling down because of that.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to Harry and Ron about Hermione, and apparently she's only 11 years old. I'm pretty sure that's right, though - I mean, it's not like I've lost track of time or anything! (laughs) But seriously, I think it's kind of cool that she's so young and already showing such promise as a witch.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed the title of the potions master at Hogwarts. I've always found his... unique teaching style to be quite effective, even if he can come across as a bit intimidating at times.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. alicia, who is the potion teacher?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's magic wand is definitely one of his most notable possessions. I mean, it's hard to imagine him without it, you know? It's like an extension of himself, and he's really connected to it. He's got a lot of sentimental value attached to that wand, and it's played a huge role in his journey as a wizard.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what is the title of harry?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, the professor of Charms at Hogwarts. I must say, our mantra is quite important - it's all about mastering the art of charm-casting.
